title: 107_s3088
content: The Act titled "Reservists and Guardsmen Pay Protection Act of 2002" ensures that federal employees in the uniformed services or National Guard will not have their pay reduced while performing active service. The "Reservists and Guardsmen Pay Protection Act of 2002" guarantees that federal employees serving in the uniformed services or National Guard will maintain their pay during active duty. This includes receiving basic pay for each pay period they are absent from their civilian government position. The "Reservists and Guardsmen Pay Protection Act of 2002" ensures that federal employees in the uniformed services or National Guard maintain their pay during active duty. This includes receiving basic pay for each pay period they are away from their civilian government position, as long as their civilian employment was not interrupted by that service. The "Reservists and Guardsmen Pay Protection Act of 2002" guarantees reemployment rights under chapter 43 of title 38 for employees on active duty, ensuring they receive basic pay during their absence from their civilian government position. The Reservists and Guardsmen Pay Protection Act of 2002 guarantees reemployment rights under chapter 43 of title 38, including the period for reporting or applying for employment after service. Payment to employees under this section is made by their employing agency from the appropriate fund, similar to basic pay. The Office of Personnel Management, in consultation with the Secretary of Defense, will prescribe regulations to implement the provisions of the Reservists and Guardsmen Pay Protection Act of 2002. Each agency must establish procedures to ensure that the reemployment rights apply to their employees, and the Federal Aviation Administration must do the same for its employees. The rights under this section apply to employees of the agency, with terms like 'employee', 'Federal Government', and 'uniformed services' having specific meanings as defined in section 4303 of title 38. Service in the uniformed services includes duty performed by National Guard members under specific directives. The term 'employing agency' refers to the Government entity where an employee has reemployment rights under title 38. 'Basic pay' includes all payments under section 5304. A clerical amendment is made to the table of sections for chapter 55 of title 5. The amendments made by this section ensure nonreduction in pay for uniformed services or National Guard duty, effective for pay periods starting on or after September 11, 2001. Additionally, a new Ready Reserve-National Guard credit is added to the Internal Revenue Code for business-related credits. The Ready Reserve-National Guard Employee Credit is added to the Internal Revenue Code for business-related credits. The Ready Reserve-National Guard employee credit under section 38 allows for a 50% credit of the actual compensation amount paid to employees on qualified active duty. The credit for Ready Reserve-National Guard employees under section 38 has limitations. The credit can only be used for up to 12 months and cannot be claimed for days when the employee was not scheduled to work. Qualified active duty refers to active duty excluding training duty. The term "duty" refers to active duty, excluding training duty, and hospitalization related to such duty, entitling an employee to reemployment rights and benefits under title 38, United States Code. The term 'compensation' refers to remuneration for employment deductible from gross income. A 'Ready Reserve-National Guard employee' is a member of the Ready Reserve or National Guard. The term 'National Guard' is defined in title 10, United States Code. The term 'Ready Reserve' and 'Ready Reserve-National Guard employee' are defined in title 10, United States Code. The Ready Reserve-National Guard employee credit is part of the general business credit under section 38 of the Code. The table of sections for subpart D of part IV of subchapter A of chapter 1 of the Internal Revenue Code of 1986 is amended by inserting a new item after section 45F. Section 45G establishes the Ready Reserve-National Guard employee credit. The amendments made by this section will apply to taxable years starting after December 31, 2001.
